key_points: Facebook apologized to the town of Bitche, France, for mistakenly shutting down its official page.
The town's page was deemed offensive by Facebook's algorithm due to its name and removed last month.
Facebook restored the Ville de Bitche page after widespread reports on the suspension.
Mayor Benoît Kieffer expressed astonishment at how long Facebook took to correct the error.
The page's removal was attributed to an incorrect analysis by Facebook's systems.
Bitche's official page was first unavailable on 19 March, prompting the creation of an alternative page.
Valérie Degouy, a spokesperson for Bitche, encountered challenges in contacting Facebook for a resolution.
The town faced similar naming issues when first creating its Facebook page in 2016.
Following the page restoration, Mayor Kieffer invited Mark Zuckerberg and the president of Facebook France to visit Bitche.
The invitation aims to honor the memory of WWII liberators who called themselves 'sons of Bitche'.
